result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel D Bruno Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 years bifurcated sentence.
STAYED. CONDITIONS THE SAME AS PROBATION

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Drug and alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances and alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers/gang member or users.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. Defendant must successfully complete and follow all rules of the Racine County Drug and Alcohol Treatment Program. No contact with any known gang members.   Firearm warning given.     Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

timeConds.notes:
Conditional time stayed 

***AMENDED 2/7/18 Lift of stayed days: Defendant is eligible to participate in the in-jail BHS AODA program.  Upon completion, balance of jail time is STAYED and defendant must complete all recommended continuing care under the supervision of the Department of Corrections.***
**Amended 1/9/19 - Lift of 3 months stayed conditional time, with credit from 1/9/19, Defendant is NOT eligible for Huber**

CORRECTED 03-27-2019:  Credit for time served to be applied upon revocation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: This case has been assigned to Judge Boyle, Branch 10 for Treatment Court
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 21, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on December 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Samuel D Bruno in court with attorney Erin Joy Larsen.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Defense is willing to accept drug court offer and he is in the process of getting his assessment with drug court.  Status conference scheduled for December 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Samuel D Bruno in court with attorney Erin Joy Larsen.  Defendant Samuel D Bruno in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Defense requests bonds be modified per motion. Defense indicates that the deft has been accepted into drug court. The State objects until the defendant is formally accepted into the drug court program. If deft is accepted into drug court, the State indicates that only then would it be appropriate to modify the bonds.

BTC: Bond modification is granted; bonds to be modified to $1,500.00 in 15CF987 and $1,500.00 in 16CF487. 16CF971 & 16CF1115 remain as currently set
